summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn about the power of prayer! In this incredible sermon, PT breaks down three critical things we need to be praying for every single day: God's peace, God's provision, and God's protection. You know how we often make prayer our last resort? Pastor Travis challenges us to flip that script and make prayer our first line of defense! Drawing from personal stories of miraculous provision - like how he and his wife adopted their third child through an incredible divine appointment - PT reminds us that God is always working, even when we can't see it. He powerfully illustrates how God provides in ways that defy human logic, whether it's helping a couple have children despite medical challenges or protecting us through life's fiercest storms. The sermon isn't just about asking God for things, it's about developing a relationship where we trust Him completely. Pastor Travis uses the incredible story of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego to show that even if God doesn't deliver us FROM the fire, He'll be WITH us IN the fire. Can you imagine having that kind of radical faith? The message is clear: God is our peace, our provider, and our ultimate protector!
mainPoints: Recognize God as the ultimate provider in your life
Seek God's protection in every situation

versesMentioned.text: The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world on the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds.
Now all glory to God who is able through his mighty power at work within us to accomplish infinitely more than we can ask or think.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.

Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped. Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, 'Teacher, don't you care if we drown?' He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, 'Quiet! Be still!' Then the wind died down and it was completely calm. He said to his disciples, 'Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?'
And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.
For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.
Jesus looked at them and said, 'With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.'
For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
But the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.

When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.
Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
'But even if he does not, we want you to know, Your Majesty, that we will not serve your gods or worship the image of gold you have set up.'

Monday.scripture: Philippians 4:6-7: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.'
Monday.focus: Learning to make prayer your first response, not your last resort
Monday.action: Create a prayer journal. List three current challenges and commit to praying about them FIRST before trying to solve them on your own.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me to turn to You first. Help me surrender my problems to You before trying to handle them in my own strength. Give me wisdom and peace that surpasses understanding. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 62:8: 'Trust in him at all times, you people; pour out your hearts to him, for God is our refuge.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding God as our ultimate provider
Tuesday.action: Review your monthly budget. Identify one area where you can practice generosity or trust God's provision more fully.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me recognize that everything I have comes from You. Teach me to be a good steward and to trust in Your provision, not my own abilities. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Wednesday.focus: Developing a posture of complete trust in God
Wednesday.action: Spend time journaling about an area of your life where you're struggling to let go and trust God completely. Identify specific ways you can surrender this to Him.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my fears and desires to You. Help me trust Your plan, even when I can't see the full picture. Give me peace that transcends my understanding. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Isaiah 26:3: 'You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds are steadfast, because they trust in you.'
Thursday.action: Practice 15 minutes of silent prayer and meditation. Focus on listening to God rather than speaking.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, quiet my heart and mind. Help me find peace in Your presence. Speak to me and help me listen more than I speak. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 John 5:14: 'This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.'
Friday.focus: Understanding the power of persistent, faith-filled prayer
Friday.action: Choose one specific area of your life where you need breakthrough. Commit to praying consistently for this need, believing God is working even when you can't see it.
Friday.prayer: Gracious God, I believe You hear my prayers. Give me faith to persist in prayer, trusting Your timing and Your plan. Help me not grow weary in seeking Your guidance. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: James 5:16: 'Therefore confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective.'
Saturday.focus: The transformative power of intercessory prayer
Saturday.action: Make a list of 3-5 people in your life who need prayer. Spend time specifically interceding for their needs, challenges, and spiritual growth.
Saturday.prayer: Father, use me as an instrument of Your peace and healing. Help me be a faithful intercessor, lifting others before Your throne with love and compassion. Show me how to pray effectively for those around me. Amen.
